Reviews.Title: All the right stuff
Reviews.Author: Michael Cohen
Reviews.Content: We purchased this TV, after deciding that we weren't interested in having our "smart" TV built in. We have an Apple Smart TV, and can always consider upgrades to this (developing and fairly inexpensive) technology. Our Sony dvd player handles our streaming needs quite well; so, otherwise what we wanted was a quality TV with a beautiful picture, as well as enough inputs/outputs to give us flexibility with our needs.This Toshiba (32L1350U) is truly a beautiful set - especially for the price! (I went ahead and took Amazon's credit card and received the $50 gift certificate - so that came off the price.) This TV has true stereo analog outputs (full size - not a single, mini-"headphone" jack, audio output), so you can easily go through a stereo receiver to quality speakers. Otherwise, 3 HDMI jacks (cable box, dvd player, etc.); as well as a PC port, and a USB, if you must use it as a computer monitor.It has absolutely beautiful color definition, a small frame - so a maximum viewing area, and the built-in speakers are really quite good! We were happy that we could still get full analog stereo, output capability and all the features of a current HD television.

Reviews.Title: 58" Toshiba 240hz Led Tv
Reviews.Author: Brent Doty
Reviews.Content: This 58" Tv is amazing, so amazing I ordered another one for my parents. I purchased my first "flat screen" back in 2007. It was a 42" Toshiba that was highly recommended in Consumer Reports. I still use it today with only one issue... The battery cover on the remote falls off easily. Everything else still works perfect on it. Im a huge gamer and love to watch sports (football, nascar, hockey, xgames) and this tv worked ok, but was a little blurry. 240hz wasn't available back then. Then a few years down the road I bought a 32" Toshiba for my bedroom. Again, no issues but I decided a few months ago that I needed to get with the times and update the 42". So, I gave my uncle my 32" and he loves it. I researched Tvs on here, bestbuy, new egg, sears, target, walmart, basically anyone that sells TVs. Everyone thinks Samsung is the way to go... I have no problems with Samsung, but they are overpriced. I have a ps3,a ps4, and a labtop that i hook up to my TV's hdmi. I want the best technology but minus the aps on it and the 3D on it. Which I personally believe isn't the greatest thing for your eyes. (Just my opinion) I came across this big guy... Now when I was going to purchase this, it was right around black Friday... Huge fan of ad watching... Everything that was cheap on BF was a cheap brand or not worth the wait. That's when I decided on this and don't regret one bit of it. Im not loaded or well off by any means. Im a veteran and a full time college student. I have been saving up money for a while just to afford a nice tv. For 899.00 (tax free and free shipping) You get a huge almost 60" tv... 240hz, which is amazing on any sports, movies or fast paced show (almost looks fake cause the clearity is so real)... Now for gamers out there... This TV was rated my numerous gaming magazines as the 3rd best tv for lag response time (the other 2 were over $2,000) However Toshiba has a "game mode" which sets everything to the exact setting for you to achieve this quickness without sacrificing image quality. COD GHOSTS LOOKS AMAZING ON PS4!!! GTA V and Gran Turismo 6 on ps3 = AMAZING! I recommend everyone that reads this... DO YOUR RESEARCH... Make sure you know what you want before you buy... I did and don't regret it! After 3 months having it... I cant believe the difference it is compared to my 42". Any responses with questions, I'll try and answer after this post. Thank you and CHEERZ to Tv  shopping!

Reviews.Title: Toshiba 58L 1350u 58 in  is a five star
Reviews.Author: Sue Troy
Reviews.Content: All are TV are Toshiba we have had no problem with any of them. The new 58 in is a amazing picture, we have a surround sound system and you feel like you are watching everything at the theater. I highly recommend this TV.

Reviews.Title: Performance of a Samsung, without the price! Superb efficiency!
Reviews.Author: T. Caradonna
Reviews.Content: This is a review for the 39" version.While Samsung is likely over-rated, Toshiba is equally under-rated.  This TV puts out a great picture AND sound.  This is also one of the most efficient TV's on the market.Pro:O  Great Picture.  Although not always 120hz (it depends on the source), the picture is fantastic.  Realistic color representation.  Works great as PC display (I use mine as part of a Home Theater PC setup).  Great viewing angle.  Plenty bright even with natural sunlight coming in the room.O  No "fancy" frills.  Forget "smart tvs", let TV manufacturer do what they do best: make a TV!  You can buy a dvd player, apple tv, roku, etc that does everything a smart tv can do.  I personally let my HTPC running Windows Media Center do all the heavy lifting.O  Has all the outputs you need.  Lately alot of manufactures are cutting back on outputs, probably keep the displays as thin/light as possible.  This has output for analog audio (goes to my sennheiser wireless headphones) and optical audio (goes to my audio receiver for when I want full theater experience).O  Built in speakers are quite capable.  A worthy sound for a thin tv!O  AWESOME energy efficiency.  Energy star rates this as 49.6Watts, but my killawatt measures it at 36.9Watts.  The Energy Star Sticker estimates $10 per year in power costs, far below the average for comparable sized screens.  And given my measurements, Energy star is overestimating the consumption.O  Clean design, uncomplicated user interface!O  Price is terrific!  This performs as well as much more expensive Samsung models which paying the unnecessary premium.  Toshiba makes great sets and has great reputation for superb engineering in Japan.  I will point out that Samsung is not nearly as popular a brand in Japan, which reinforces my belief that perception about brand and quality is very relative.Cons:O  Base is a bit wobbly for my tastes, but is adequate given the light weight of the TV itself.  I only notice when I turn the TV to face a different room.  (Which I do frequently, and it has been no problem whatsoever)O  Other reviewers have mentioned the low sensitivity of the remote.  I admit it's a bit weak, but it's not so hard to aim it at the TV.  Really the only time I need it is to turn on/off or change volume.  These days most viewing control is done thru media devices anyway (my HTPC in my case), so I'm not bothered, and I suspect neither will most people.  (Who doesn't have a media player of some type these days?  Tivo, Cable box, Roku, DVD player, etc...)O  I wish the TV would auto-power down faster after not detecting a signal, or allow the user to customize this.  I think it takes about 20 minutes.Overall, I am very happy with this TV!  I would absolutely purchase again and recommend this TV.  5 starsPlease feel free to leave a comment/question as I'm happy to reply.Update 4/5/2014:Still very happy with this TV.  Just wanted to add that the TV and the stand stood up very nicely to all the earthquakes we've been having.

Reviews.Title: AWFUL Customer Service Experience
Reviews.Author: Brandon2063
Reviews.Content: I purchased two of the 29L1350U LCD monitors to use as in a CCTV application.  Within a few months of installation each of the units displayed instances of random power cycling (the monitors will power off and back on during use).  An internet search of this phenomenon indicates that my monitors are not unique in this behavior.One unit has only performed this random power cycle on three occasions over six months (and though annoying, this will seem acceptable as you read on).  The second TV, however, is unusable, as it power cycles four or more times per hour - in some instances requiring unplugging for several minutes before it will resume function.The defective unit is less than six months old, so after contacting their customer service, I sent it to a Toshiba authorized repair depot.  I was responsible for shipping, which is frustrating, but acceptable.  The unit was allegedly "repaired" (a new motherboard was installed) but upon its return it exhibited the same behavior IMMEDIATELY after being reconnected to a power supply.  I was told to send the unit for a second round of service (again at my shipping expense) and that if the unit could not be repaired "other options" would be explored.  I have received it back from this second repair and it still does not work. I have spoken to customer service, warranty service , and customer relations personnel, including several "managers." I am told that there is no option to have a replacement TV issued, only to resubmit to the same repair depot, AT MY COST.  The "other options" are that they will request that a senior technician inspect the TV (implying that the lower level technician should not have been trusted to complete a successful diagnostic and repair?).If I am to submit the set again, I will have spent $75 on shipping to repair an ongoing problem for a $190 TV.  This experience has taught me that a Toshiba warranty is not worth the paper it is written on.  I intend to file a complaint with my local bureau of consumer protection / the Better Business Bureau, as well as post as many online warnings to would-be-customers as I possibly can.  I used to look at Toshiba as a trusted brand name and a reputable company.  I understand that any manufacturer can have problems with products.  A reputable company cannot guarantee that all of its equipment will be without defect, only that they will help to restore the consumer who was burdened with a defective item.  The issue is not the faulty TV.  The issue is the horrendous run-around that I am being put through in my attempts to resolve the issue.  This is the last Toshiba item that I will ever purchase, PERIOD.

Reviews.Title: Great gaming tv!!
Reviews.Author: exodus
Reviews.Content: I use this tv for gaming 99.9% percent of the time ,and It handles gaming wonderfully.  it took me about two weeks to calibrate a picture that i was very happy with ,but once i did games look great on it. Now let's get down to the most important part of what makes a tv good for gaming tv: the input lag all HDtvs suffer from it to some extent some a lot worse than others ,but this one has no noticeable lag according to a certain website the 39" version of this tv clocked in around 30ms which is considered great for gaming.  So if you play competitivly online like i do your not put at a disadvantage. especially with fighting games and first person shooters. My only knock against this tv is that it has a slight vertical banding issue only noticable when the screen is one mostly one color. But i am happy to say that this tv has a pretty uniformed screen ,and does not suffer from flashlighting which is another common led tv issue. I paid around six hundred and fifty dollars for this tv and so far very happy with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: For the price it is ok
Reviews.Author: daedelus7
Reviews.Content: I got this on sale at Best Buy for $350 and for the price I don't think you can really get much better picture in "120hz" and 39". I'll compare build and functionality to my last TV a 2009 samsung 22"LCD.Cons:-So here is a dirty secret I discovered. The "clearscan" 120Hz prominently printed on the box doesn't exist in my settings. So i'm not sure if it is really doing 120 or just 60. Yes, I know what i'm doing, I even downloaded the manual and it has directions directly referring to this exact model, go to advanced picture settings and toggle on/off cinema mode. Regardless of picture mode it's greyed out. A quick google search revealed others with the same problem. I might contact customer service to see what they say and I'll update if I get to it. But from what i've read 120vs60 is not a big deal. The difference between "game mode", supposedly reducing input lag is marginal compared to the other modes but I think it is better than say cinema for games. The refresh rate seems improved at least on "game mode" compared to my old Samsung and it works well for games and movies my main uses. Saving some money and going to 60hz is something that you might consider. I think my final conclusion is we are getting improved refresh rate from 60hz but it is hard to notice. You don't get the "soap opera" effect like with my parents 240hz Panasonic. Where if you put it on high processing it looks really high frame rate.-The remote is very cheaply made compared to my old remote from 2009. You have to go out of your way to aim directly at the IR port. Kinda surprising you could mess up a remote in 2013. Samsung remote works normal point it in the direction of the TV and it works. I think some of the unresponsiveness has to do with the tv taking 3-4 seconds between when you hit power on the remote and turning on.-The stand is very poorly engineered. My model is ever so slightly tipping to the left after installing it correctly and pushing on the tv causes it to wobble around WITH the TV screwed into the stand. I plan to put it on a wall mount so that should solve that problem. Wishing they just copied samsung's no tools or screws required foolproof stand.-I had to exchange the first TV I got because there was a dead pixel. Second TV was fine. The first TV's stand was fine, in terms of being level, albeit wobbly. This dead pixel out of the box on the first TV kind of makes me worry about how long the TV will last. My Samsung from 2009 is still trucking with a little brightness discoloration spots.-Menu user interface is slightly worse/funky compared to my old tv.Pros:-At around $200 cheaper than the comparable Samsung model i'm willing to put up with the Cons to avoid the samsung brand tax.-The picture is all around better than my 2009 TV as you would hope. Only problem is the blacks are really black and I found myself boosting up the gamma +4 out of a max +5 because it was just too dark, abnormally so if you ask me.-3 HDMI ports. Many TVs this size only have 2. I'm going to plug consoles into all of them. Generally lots of output options Samsung seems to just leave off this size of TV bizarrely these days. I would like to plug my TV into speakers thanks.-The TV barely is warm on top after extensive use indicating how much energy the LED technology saves.-The sound is about as good as my Samsung from 2009 probably marginally better and louder.So in the end I think it is a good deal. I'm happy gaming and netflixing on it so far and I'm willing to deal with some quirks for the price.UPDATE 10/15/2013:Support interaction information: Spoke to Jerry, reference number 131007-004922.I called Toshiba customer service to find out two things. How do I upgrade the firmware for the TV. And why is cinema mode greyed out and "off" in the menu, when the manual says that I can turn it on. After 30 minutes the CSR told me they needed to have a tier 2 person call me back and there is no firmware update. Problem is, on their own website when I enter the model number on the support page at support.toshiba.com it shows there IS a firmware update. I was told I would get a call back the next day and haven't heard from them 2 weeks later.  So based on my interactions I would say avoid a Toshiba TV because they have poor customer service in the support department. I certainly got the run around when I tried to ask why advertised features were not working.UPDATE 10/17/2013:I was able to update the firmware from some help from another reviewer in the comments of this review. I am now running 1.08 firmware and there has been no change in menu options.

Reviews.Title: Nice bang for the buck
Reviews.Author: moose_of_many_waters
Reviews.Content: I picked this up for less than 200 bucks on sale.  I'm not much of a TV watcher and I don't even have cable TV.  I just watch PBS and special yearly events like the Oscars and the Rose Parade off my antenna.  Mostly I watch movies off my Blu-Ray player.  This TV was bought to replace my old 26" LCD Panasonic Viera (about six years old).  The picture quality of this LED TV is definitely superior to what I had and it's nice that I get 31.5" inches of screen in the same space of my bookcase that used to hold my 26" TV.  Sound quality is solid, and the digital tuner is also superior to the old one on my Panasonic (I'm getting clear reception on channels that used to be sketchy).  The one thing that is inferior is the time lag in changing channels; it's a bit longer with this TV, but nothing ridiculous in terms of a wait.  This unit also has a glossy screen, and personally I prefer matte screens.  My TV isn't near a window,  so any glare is minor, but if you plan to watch this TV during the day and your house gets lots of light, you might prefer a different model.The remote is fairly intuitive.  The only complaint I have is that this unit didn't come with a hard copy manual.  I had to download one off the internet.  That's being a little too cheap in my opinion.  But other than that, I'd say that this TV is an excellent value.

Reviews.Title: What a Bargain!!!
Reviews.Author: starr
Reviews.Content: With Toshiba, you have top-of-the-line quality. The price (on sale) was surprisingly low so we ordered 2! My dad saw it and ordered one for himself. So, we ended up with three that we are very pleased with!

Reviews.Title: I love my new 58L1350.
Reviews.Author: James B Deatsch
Reviews.Content: This is my third Toshiba flat screen and I love it.  I just keep going with Toshiba because of the quality.I'm using a RaspeberyPi for streaming, Dish Network for other stuff, and a Sony Blu-Ray DVD player and all are exemplary with my new Toshiba.I upgraded from a 40" Toshiba Plasma to this backlit LED and find it just great.I really cannot say enough about this TV.  You'll love yours as well.

Reviews.Title: Great Picture
Reviews.Author: Kerry Graham
Reviews.Content: This TV is much better than the COBY I returned. The sound is very good and the picture is awesome!

Reviews.Title: Toshiba 50L1350U review
Reviews.Author: shopaholic
Reviews.Content: This is the first review of the Toshiba 50L1350U.  Just bought from S...S (rhymes with beers).  I returned the Toshiba 50L5200U.  This one is perfect.  Great color, contrast, black levels and is about 10 lbs. lighter.  Was able to put on the stand and put on table by myself easily.  This one is not a thin tv but I have found that the thicker ones tend to be lighter.  The sound is very good and can be heard easily (with the very thin tv's there's no room  for big speakers).  But I hooked up 2 soundbars (one for left and one for right channel; along with a BIC F12 subwoofer and WOW WOW WOW.  It has 3 HDMI inputs and a pc input (how much would it cost for a 50" pc monitor? lol.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful picture, good sound
Reviews.Author: Kimberly Galante "Kim"
Reviews.Content: I am very happy with my purchase of this TV. The picture is beautiful, very clear. The sound is also very good. This is a very good price for this TV. I am thinking of getting another for my bedroom. I highly recommend this TV.

Reviews.Title: Better than generic
Reviews.Author: invalidprotocol
Reviews.Content: The Good:Plenty of connectivity options.  Decent implementation of 120hz motion control. Decent remote layout for inexpensive TV.The Bad:Poor color accuracy.  Foreground objects may change in hue depending on the colors in the background.  Pronounced LED lighting anomalies surrounding moving objects.  Uneven lighting that is dimmer in the corners.  Harsh shadows and contrast levels that you can't quite seem to get set right.  Black level is so-so. Remote quality isn't too great.Overall:A name brand with reasonable reliability and good connectivity options.  This TV is a good low cost alternative to no-name brands while still providing a strong offering of connectivity options usually offered on higher dollar TV's.  For those picky about color accuracy and lighting quality, you'd best look elsewhere.  The problems this TV has have been solved in competing name brand units.

Reviews.Title: Toshiba Warranty Service is Atrocious
Reviews.Author: Reader by Nature
Reviews.Content: First thing, I did not buy this tv through Amazon (wish I would have), but Best Buy. Out of the box the tv had a screen defect. There are these ripples of gray towards the top left of the screen that can be seen on lighter backgrounds. I thought I had 30 days to return the tv, but Best Buy recently changed their policy and only gave 14 days, so . . . I called Toshiba to activate the warranty. First they said the model number from the back of the tv did not exist. I had to take a picture of it and email it to Toshiba--the makers of the tv--to prove I was giving them the right model number. Okay, no problem. They tell me the tv is covered, call tech support. I call tech support. They try to walk me through all these steps to "fix" the picture when it is clearly a screen defect. I've invested about 45 minutes of my life, but okay this must be protocol. They finally say that the tv will need to be taken to a repair facility and fixed under warranty. They give the name and number of a place. The place never answers the phone. I finally get through to the repair place after days of trying and the guy tells me Toshiba should have given me an authorization number. Well, they didn't. Call back tech support. They have no idea what I am talking about. Finally, after being on hold the guy comes back and says, oh yes here is your authorization number. I call back the repair place a few times, finally get them on the line, and the guy tells me to bring the tv in at 4pm. I wait an hour in front of his shop before the repair guy shows up. Beyond frustrated at this point, but at any rate, I leave the tv. Next day the repair guy calls me and says that Toshiba will not cover cost of repairing the tv, they say the screen was damaged by someone hitting it? Yes, I make a habit of smacking around my flat screens. If that wasn't bad enough, this tv is advertised as 120hz, but on the back of the tv it says 60hz. So disgusted with Toshiba. I have laptops from them that are great, but I will not be a repeat customer after my experience with the tv. I seriously want to through the thing in the garbage.

Reviews.Title: it's a 60Hertz tv
Reviews.Author: Animal
Reviews.Content: i went to the Toshiba website and it says in order to enable clearscan you must have you TV on Cinema mode. beacause "There are no seperate settings for clearscan"i was reading an article where it said some tv's use fancy language to make people think they are 120 hertz, i think thats what "Clearscan" is for this TV. The TV has a refresh rate of 60 frames per second and there is no way to change it to 120 hertz. 120 Hertz clearscan must be something else. The I was playing Xbox one on this TV and the picture looked great. I just don't think it's 120 hertz refresh rate.

Reviews.Title: Could Have Been Built Better
Reviews.Author: R. Beltz
Reviews.Content: At the recommendation of my son, I bought two of these TVs last summer on sale at Best Buy: a 39" and a 23" for my partially-finished basement. These were the first flat-screen TVs that I have ever owned, after owning a 12" Sony Triniton, a 26" Panasonic and a 12" Toshiba over the past 40+ years.  Here are my findings:Pros - Lightweight, clear picture, good choice of inputsCons - VERY cheaply made compared to my son's Toshibas which are 4-5 years old. The base is a complete joke as the TV wobbles easily. The screen itself is mounted in a very cheap frame. It is hard to tune the picture, especially flesh tones. The TV doesn't even have a display function for the local time!Overall, Toshiba could have done much better with this TV line. There are much better flat-screen TVs out there in a similar price range.

Reviews.Title: Looks nice but
Reviews.Author: J. Maz
Reviews.Content: Had since July 2013. TV is nice size, picture quality is good.  Issue with the volume buttons not working from the remote or the TV. Thought it was the cable remote but replaced that and still not working.  Contacted Toshiba, went through all kinds of resetting but was difficult as the TV does not respond well to the remote.  Gave me the phone number to have it serviced but that phone number was out of service.  Called back and got a different service center but cannot call them until Monday.  Very frustrated when a brand new product does not work.

Reviews.Title: Great gaming tv for XBox one!
Reviews.Author: willy
Reviews.Content: I read reviews on this Television from TV lag websites this was one of the ones with great hardly no lag for gaming.  And it turned out to be awesome.  Great response time from the controller to game.  I think its 27ms  of lag which is really good compared to others. The picture with HD cable tv is pretty nice  .  Also the new xbox one  looks totally awesome on this TV. I would recommend this tv to everyone.  The price is great also.Cons-The deliver isn't consistence. They had me selet a date and then the next day made me reschedule and still delivered on the same day as scheduled before. I didn't care for that cause i had to change my days off twice so i could be home for delivery.

Reviews.Title: had to go online and download the manual
Reviews.Author: R. Morgan "techno-geek"
Reviews.Content: you need HD cable to appreciate the picture. menu on TV setup is a bit sketchy, had to go online and download the manual. TV is very light weight and it does wobble,(I bought 2 for gifts) attached them to the shelf back. The TV sits on a wood entertainment center. I purchased some tie downs to help, so far so good. I got "Dreambaby 2 Pack Flat Screen TV Saver, Black" about 8 dollars. be sure to pre-drill the holes to attach wood screws(provided), adjust the straps like you would do on a backpack and you won't have problems with the plastic buckles, each end is painted metal and all screws are provided. I think mounting on the wall would be better if possible. Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: Great picture, average sound
Reviews.Author: Here Fishy Fishy
Reviews.Content: What can I say? This is a TV. Everything works perfectly and there is virtually no setup - plug in and go. I use this in my office to the side of my desk. Other TVs I have tried did not have good viewing from a side angle - you had to be directly straight in front of the TV to view the picture. That is not a problem with this  unit. High, low, side-to-side makes no appreciable difference. The picture quality is good from all angles. The sound quality is rather weak as I would expect from such a small unit but I wasn't looking for a good stereo system so I wasn't unhappy with the sound. If you want to get full room sound, this is probably not for you in either size or sound quality.

Reviews.Title: Toshiba 39L1350U 1080P LED TV
Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: This Toshiba 39 inch TV is the perfect bedroom size and can be set on a stand or mounted to the wall any where in the bedroom or in the home has an exceptional picture and also has 3 HDMI connections to add an assortment of electronic attachments.

Reviews.Title: Great HD TV or computer monitor
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "Extra class ham"
Reviews.Content: This TV/monitor is an amazingly good product. You can use it as a TV, computer monitor, or both at the same time. The price is about the same as a good quality 23" monitor, so you're getting an HD TV for free with this. I used it as a TV in a guest bedroom. It was easy to wall mount, not overly heavy for the size, and is slim enough so it takes up practically no space when it's folded flat against the wall. The picture quality is as good as I've ever seen with a true HD signal. Even if you don't have HD, the picture quality is above average. Snap this baby up, especially when it goes on sale.

Reviews.Title: Above Average TV
Reviews.Author: Right2Carry
Reviews.Content: Good picture, good sound, easy controls, easy setup.  A journeyman television, completely suited to its task of being the bedroom TV, used while getting dressed in the morning. It reminds me of the lukewarm praise cluelessly given to Major Frank Burns by "Hotlips" Houlihan in a M.A.S.H. episode - "Oh, Frank!  You're so above average!"  We bought this TV because various reviewers had rated its sound quality as better than others.  It is, but only marginally, because of the built-in limitations of flat TVs - there is no cavity for a proper speaker baffle.  It was noticeably tinny compared to the 32" CRT it replaced.

Reviews.Title: Love the picture qualty.  Here are some ideas to inprove the remote controll , It worked for me
Reviews.Author: Wm. Claypoole
Reviews.Content: I love the picture on my Toshiba 50l1350. It would have been nice to have a yellow/ red /white input. How ever I worked a round that with a hdmi converter. I  agree that the remote is poor at best. Here is a way to improve the remote problem. If you have an old dvd , cd or vcr that no longer works , remove  the plastic front that covers the IR receiver .  Cut that part of the plastic out. ( the plastic that covered the IR receiver. )  Tape (clear tape ) it over the IR receiver on the ty.  You will find the remote works much better w/ the ty.  ( I think the problem is the ty sees white light { because there is no white light filter} which makes it much harder to detect the inferred light)  Putting the filter on the the remote helps, putting the filter on the tv seems to work best.Bill from Fl.

Reviews.Title: Another excellent Toshiba Value
Reviews.Author: Karen Baker
Reviews.Content: Great picture and sound for an inexpensive tv. Excellent value and quality. I have purchased other tvs this size and this is by far the best I have found. It is my second Toshiba TV because it is the best quality tv in the house. Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: The only downer is the remote - tiny buttons, not backlit
Reviews.Author: Prime
Reviews.Content: The only downer is the remote - tiny buttons, not backlit.  Picture and sound are very good for a small HDTV.

Reviews.Title: I would not buy again
Reviews.Author: Operations Rick
Reviews.Content: I bought the 23 inch model because I had the 32" model. Both worked, but would occasionally add random channels to the menu, both would sometimes go to a channel NOT selected before going to the selected channel.The 32" unit finally stopped working after 19 months. The 23" unit is newer and still working, but sometimes shuts off the sound. I have to go back and forth between channels a few times before the sound comes back.I like the picture on both units and was happy with them when they worked correctly, but the quality is much less than I expect from Toshiba. I will not buy this model again. Even with the good price, I think the problems and short life make them a poor value.

Reviews.Title: Good Sound, for an average LED TV
Reviews.Author: kel
Reviews.Content: It works, for that price, it has pretty good sound and image, maybe the user experience is not the best, the remote could be better... but in general terms it works good.the image is nice and bright.pretty decent product.

Reviews.Title: love it
Reviews.Author: Kim Hinds
Reviews.Content: i truley love this tv more than expected. perfect size. really good picture. easy to hook up to, lite weight,

Reviews.Title: Great picutre and easy to set up!
Reviews.Author: Victoria E Soto
Reviews.Content: After months of researching tv's (when did it get so hard to buy a tv!??) I finally settled on this Toshiba because of the brand and the price.  So far so good.  The picture is nice, clear and bright!  Sound is full.  I've hooked up my Roku, dvd player, AND VHS player (yes, you read that correctly) and I am happy as a clam.

Reviews.Title: May not make you a very good computer monitor
Reviews.Author: Richard Schissler III "Rick S."
Reviews.Content: Picture quality is not as good as I hoped. I use it for an additional computer monitor and it is not as sharp with text as I need.

Reviews.Title: Good TV for the price
Reviews.Author: Janet D Newport
Reviews.Content: Purchased for a bedroom TV to replace a (working) old giant that I was tired of dusting.  Perfect size for the room.  Easy to set up.

Reviews.Title: Nice look
Reviews.Author: Justin
Reviews.Content: Easy set-up with my computer. It makes a great monitor and I use one of the HDMI inputs. The only thing i wish it did was play movies through the USB port, like the movie files I have on my jumpstick. It has no problem displaying picture files nicely though. It's a great TV at low price. I paid $179

Reviews.Title: Good TV great Price
Reviews.Author: Matthew Dansereau "Matty79"
Reviews.Content: Toshiba 50L1350U 50-Inch 1080p 120Hz LED HDTVJust bought this TV yesterday.This is about the 50-Inch model:Setup was super easySet is light weight and well designed.I played an action game (GTA 5) from my PS3, no issues with blurryness (contrary to other reviews - I think they were talking about other sized models).I watched videos on Netflix and clarity / depth display was very nice.I did notice some pixilation when a scene would fade out that may have been the quality of the movie I was streaming.So far very happy with the purchase.

Reviews.Title: Great TV!
Reviews.Author: Barton OBrien
Reviews.Content: Great TV to fit exactly into the space at my parent's home.  They are extremely pleased with this purchase.  Recommended.

Reviews.Title: Good picture but missing some connections
Reviews.Author: Tony
Reviews.Content: For the price this is a great TV. Has a good picture and sound, but it only has HDMI connections. If you have any equipment that uses the older RCA (Yellow, Red & White) connections they will not work with this TV.  It does have a component video connection which didn't help me any.  So I had to purchase a $50 adapter to play my Nintendo Wii on.  Otherwise a very good TV.

Reviews.Title: bedroom tv
Reviews.Author: RAM
Reviews.Content: nice size for bedroom. replaced 26" sanyo with intermittent on/off  after 2 yrs.. one month old , good pix. great price.

Reviews.Title: Priced Right
Reviews.Author: Patricia Collins
Reviews.Content: The picture quality is crisp and smooth. There is no remote code included and no remote code on the Toshiba site. Had to research the Satilite tv provider site to find the code.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the money
Reviews.Author: E. Levine
Reviews.Content: We love it - arrived on time.  Carrier was super nice.  Product was easy to assemble and install.  We are enjoying it immensely.  Sounds is great and picture quality is great.

Reviews.Title: Toshiba makes a piece of JUNK!!!!
Reviews.Author: J. Stetson
Reviews.Content: Had this tv for exactly 4 months when it died. No power. Nothing. Called the customer service department and I must send them the unit at my own expense and find a box to put this piece of trash in. I asked them to provide a box and they told me to take it to a UPS center and buy one from them. I expected them to send me a replacement tv and I would then send them the broken one in the box I received but I guess that's just too difficult for them to do. I also think they should cover the postage for this defective junk they sold me. After going online I found out the 4 month mark is pretty typical for their products to self destruct. I am over this company and will never do business with them again.

Reviews.Title: Gaming TV Gone Wild
Reviews.Author: RabidAtlas
Reviews.Content: This review is for the 50" version of this TV, which is the one I purchased.  I wanted a TV primarily for my gaming room, which would be responsible for displaying sporting events, a computer monitor, and an Xbox 360 and a PS4.  The reason I picked this TV was the input lag, a feature not often talked about..  The input lag database clocks this TV at 27ms.  That's really low, and lower is better.  So if you're looking for a gaming TV, you're going to want something like this, and for the money, you're not going to find a better TV this size at a lower price.There are a few things I feel could be improved.  Namely, I wish you could create custom names for the inputs.  Instead, you can leave them as "HDMI 1" "HDMI 2" or you can pick from a provided list.  But without custom names, instead of "Verizon FIOS" "360" and "PS4" I end up with "Cable TV" "Game" "Game".  Not a huge deal, but my livingroom TV lets me do this and its a small feature I miss.Also, in the bottom-right you'll find a green circle that lights up when the TV is on.  You can push that circle and naturally I thought it was the power button.  It didn't work, and I was able to turn the TV on and off with the remote.  It turns out, that isn't the power button.  The power button is located behind the TV on the left-hand side, along with the channel, volume, and input buttons.  It's just sort of hidden away back there.The stand is a bit boring and there is nothing to make the TV itself stand out aside from the stellar display.  Also, I didn't notice it in the pictures, but there is a gap between the bottom stand and the TV where it's a silver metal instead of the black plastic, which does look a tad bit odd.The display itself is exactly what I wanted.  Sharp images, good blacks, nice contrast.  Viewing angle is okay, and picture isn't too glossy so the brightness of the room isn't critical.  Perfect for gaming, great for sports, and good for movies.  5 out of 5 stars, I'd buy this again.

Reviews.Title: The right choice
Reviews.Author: Douglas E Businger
Reviews.Content: Fairly impressed actually. What sold me was seeing one in a store and the viewing angle was so much better than another highly rated brand next to it. The set up was very easy. The sound is amazing, some reviews say the sound is lacking, it's not. If this is the size you're looking for then this is the one.

Reviews.Title: Great picture, sound needs external help
Reviews.Author: A. Bailey "woodwright"
Reviews.Content: Great picture and detail. Sound is lacking since the speakers are in the back of the set. We cured he sound problem with a sound bar.

Reviews.Title: 3 hdmi inputs, a great picture
Reviews.Author: proman
Reviews.Content: I was considering a lcd tv at first, but i'm happy I bought this led instead, its a brighter picture and the 120hz refresh rate was another reason. 720 p is all you need for a tv of 32inches, gives all the detail and clarity I need. The colors are calibrated at the factory and it worked great right out of the box. Its the most bang for the buck, I could find. I am only disappointed about one thing....the base base the tv kinda wobbly,and unstable, but the toshiba use the same base for all their tv's up to 50 inch models. I opted to wall mount it with the Cheetah mounts lcd wall mount bracket, so that took care of that problem! Also the viewing of the picture off side is very good, so you dont have to sit only in front of it to view a great picture. So glad I bought a led tv vs.a lcd, lcd was the forerunner, but with lcd, theres a bulb that periodically needs replacing, its what makes the picture since the display is liquid, its backlit, a bulb costs about $200.00, but with a led tv, theres no backlighiting, its a series of light emitting diodes (led), which should make it more dependable and definately gives the tv its brighter more accurate picture, blacks are pure, whites are clean, gold looks gold and silver is silver. This tv sells for 399.00 at Pest Buy....so Amazon has the best deal!

Reviews.Title: Good Value
Reviews.Author: Thomas M. Anderson
Reviews.Content: We bought this TV for our motorhome.  It has a great picture and is simple to set up.  Downside it that the audio is just OK, but if you have it hooked to a separate audio system you will love this TV.

Reviews.Title: Glad to receive a good TV
Reviews.Author: Ben Hoschouer
Reviews.Content: Even with Standard Definition the color and quality was good.  With the HD the picture is very very clear and the skin colors are right on.  My wife really enjoys her new TV.  And the size is just right for the space that it sits in.  The sound quality is pleasant, not high and shrill.  For most programming that doesn't require a theater sound system the audio is adequate. The stand that is provided wobbles.  This isn't to important to us because we do not have children in our home.

Reviews.Title: Black spot on top edge turned into an un-viewable screen
Reviews.Author: Nightbringer
Reviews.Content: I ordered this for my parent's who lived in a different state.  Apparently there was a black 'spot' at the top edge of the screen that they didn't notice when the TV arrived.  My brother noticed it when he visited and now this spot has turned the screen into, what looks like a cracked LCD screen.  It's been over a month so I cannot return it (mea culpa) so am now stuck with attempting a repair by Toshiba...

Reviews.Title: Excellent tv
Reviews.Author: amazonian
Reviews.Content: It has nice picture and good sound quality. All necessary inputs are available.The remote controller is the only way to operate it. There is not even a power on/off button on the set.The  setup may not be intuitive for connecting a computer. Had to call support to learn that other than the inputs you have to go down to options to get both picture and sound.

Reviews.Title: good quality
Reviews.Author: chia-hsiu
Reviews.Content: The only drawback is the stand is not very strong. The TV would sway, if you want to plug something. Also, the TV setting is not very user friendly. It took a while for me to know how it works. However, the sound and the color are perfect. I just got it one month ago. Hope everything would be good in the future..

Reviews.Title: image sharpness, color rendition excellent
Reviews.Author: James Steven Nichols
Reviews.Content: for the price range color rendition and image sharpnessare superior  120Hz aids in action scene images No extra bells and whistles, justgood solid picture quality

Reviews.Title: Great Investment for the money
Reviews.Author: C. Ruston "Creative Technicians"
Reviews.Content: For A LED , this is very well priced, and it also works well for a PC monitor, it took sometime to find a resolution that would work with my laptop.Very light, Very Slim, good sound, well worth the moneyCan see from any n all angles no darkening which is good and the 120hz helps with action flix and games

Reviews.Title: I had the 32" So, I figured 39 would work just as well
Reviews.Author: William G. Haver "Lawnman"
Reviews.Content: As having a Toshiba 32" LED 1080p which had worked out great, I thought I would upgrade just a small amount both in size and price to the 39" LED 1080p w/120mhz refresh rate - the picture is superb! the 120mhz does make the difference in watching fast action movies and even using it as a monitor for X-Box games. The game graphics refresh and fill with unnoticeable speed and clarity - which in gaming can be key. Well, yes having Hi-Speed Fios doesn't hurt either.

Reviews.Title: Toshiba Led TV
Reviews.Author: Martha Dennard
Reviews.Content: Good picture and good sound. My son bought one and I was so impressed with his that I bought one. Good quality product.

Reviews.Title: Received today and am already enjoying the purchase - 4 stars
Reviews.Author: Scott Kessler
Reviews.Content: Pros:(1) Great cost.(2) Fantastic picture/color considering the fact that it's somewhat of a budget TV.(3) 120hz really comes through after moving from a 1080p / 60hz TV to this 720p / 120 hz TV.(4) Gaming is amazing. Very vivid colors and the animations are without any lagging.(5) Hooked up the Xbox360 for more than gaming and tried out Netflix. Some shows need a lot of volume, but speech is much better on the TV than most flat screen HDTVs.(6) Not much, if any, LED "bleeding."Cons:(1) The stand is kinda shoddy. Despite needing to screw in the base to the TV, the is still a little wobble and I think the TV is titled to the left just a bit.(2) The speakers are good for a HDTV, but I still think I'll need to use external speakers of my own.I'll update if anything comes up as I use the TV more.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for a great price
Reviews.Author: fantasy reader
Reviews.Content: I recently bought this TV.  It was my first flat screen television and I'm glad I bought it.  The picture is crisp.  It has excellent sound.  Many flat screens have poor sound but not this one.  The only drawback is that it doesn't handle Analog inputs very well.  If you have a WII or a DVD player without HDMI you'll need to get RCA to HDMI converters.  But still well worth the price.

Reviews.Title: Exactly what I was looking for!
Reviews.Author: 7rory5
Reviews.Content: I just picked up this TV from a local brick-and-mortar because they matched Amazon's price - including reducing it to make up for having to charge tax.  I was surprised how light it was as well as the ease of set-up.  I AM THRILLED WITH THIS TV!!  The picture was great right out of the box - with only a small, powered HD antenna!  Our computers and the Blu-Ray player are equally stunning.  The dimensions of it worked to get us the biggest screen size possible while still fitting in our cabinet.  I never thought we'd get a 39"!  Plus, with this model having 3 HDMI connections, RCA audio out and smooth motion I couldn't be happier!

Reviews.Title: Cool and crisp
Reviews.Author: Scott Olson
Reviews.Content: Good picture, LED is cool and doesn't heat up the house or use as much energy as many others.It was easy to hook up and works great in the bedroom.

Reviews.Title: Love Our New TV
Reviews.Author: T. Doyle "BargainShopperMomof3"
Reviews.Content: We have had it for over a month and love the picture and sound quality.  It was for our spare room and we couldn't be happier.  It is used for movie watching and gaming.  The seller was great and shipped it to me very quick.

Reviews.Title: Took two attempts, but still happy.
Reviews.Author: Cruise Master "SnowBird"
Reviews.Content: This TV was sold by Amazon which I was very happy about. The first one was delivered with a defective outer frame. It would allow a very bright line to appear at the top. Amazon as always made the return easy and a new TV was shipped immediately. Second TV has been running with no issues for a week now. We enjoy the picture, but what is the real bonus is the sound. I can at last understand what is being said on a flat screen TV.For some odd reason flat screens seem not to care about the audio quality. This Toshiba must have cared, and for that one main reason I would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: Great tv, won't find one better at this price
Reviews.Author: alex thill
Reviews.Content: This TV is awesome, the picture is perfect. I've read some people have problems with it, when in use with an HDMI cable it's perfect. I've watched a lot of action movies and no problem at all with the 120 refresh rate. My bluray player upscales non bluray movies and the picture is still great. I love the sound options with this TV, a lot of new tvs have horrible sound, not this one.

Reviews.Title: Big picture in a small set!
Reviews.Author: C. Hubler
Reviews.Content: Beautiful 1080p images, when calibrated properly.  Great viewing angles side-to-side and from top of screen (though I don't think the screen is IPS type).  Works great as PC monitor.  (3) HDMI inputs a blessing.  Almost 3D type depth of field with 1080i source material.  Built-in digital tuner works extremely well; received all channels in Los Angeles market.  Though its digital signal strength meter isn't the greatest.  Highly recommended and quite affordable.

Reviews.Title: Toshiba 39L1350U LED HDTV
Reviews.Author: Andrew
Reviews.Content: The Toshiba 39L1350U LED HDTV is a great TV.  Setup was easy, excellent picture, and very good sound.On top of that the price was great and delivery beat the estimated delivery date.  Can't get much better than that.

Reviews.Title: Best picture in the house!
Reviews.Author: ROLLIE SEIBERT
Reviews.Content: Have had this 23" Toshiba for 2 months now. It's got the best picture of all my TVs, including my big screen Panasonic and JVC. I bought a Samsung first but the wall mount plate covered the HDMI inputs so exchanged it for a Toshiba. Wow! Much better picture than the Samsung. Good sound too (considering). I have been so happy with it I just bought a second one for the beach house.

Reviews.Title: HDTV Value
Reviews.Author: Lowell DeHaven
Reviews.Content: Have had the 50" Toshiba for several weeks now and am happy with the set.  Good picture, clarity and color right out of the box with factory defaults.  No bad or black pixtel areas.  Arrived with forklift puncture hole in the box from some forklift monkey during distribution process, but it missed damaging the unit itself.  The mounting stand design is a piece of crap...plan on wall mounting or extra support if using the unit standing on its own.

Reviews.Title: 'Great monitor / TV! 'Can't beat the price!
Reviews.Author: Tom Jr
Reviews.Content: We bought two of these Toshiba 39-inch, 1080p, 120Hz, LED HDTVs as xbox 360 monitors to use with two system-linked (and on "xbox live") controllers. So far, they are working great! They replaced two older Sony 32-inch, 1080p, 120Hz, LCD TV monitors that we bought about six years ago (they were great too; unfortunately, the power supply card in one of the monitors died and could not be ecomonically repaired). The picture is bright and dynamic! The audio is more than adequate for gaming. Amazingly, given that the plastic border surrounding the screeen is so narrow, they two monitors, side-by-side, take up just about the same amount of wall space as the previous two Sony monitors. Lastly, the two Toshiba monitors combined cost less than one of the higher-end "gaming" Sony 32-inch LCD monitors I purchased six years ago.... You can't beat the price. The Toshiba's are a great bargain! 'Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: Terrific picture
Reviews.Author: a reader "maxona"
Reviews.Content: I own 2 Toshiba TV's. I needed a smaller TV and searched for the Toshiba brand. If you have cable with HD on your TV, I think you will really be pleased with this product. The color is very good. I didn't feel the need to adjust the color on my set at all. The channels that come in as HD are crystal clear. I also can project my computer screen on the TV (with a netgear product) and it is even clearer than on my computer sceen. The cost for such a good product can't be beat. Once again, if you are looking for an affordable TV with an excellent picture, I think you will be pleased if you purchase this brand and product.

Reviews.Title: Theproduct has poor quality
Reviews.Author: Mingwei Yang
Reviews.Content: Sometimes sound may be gone for no reason when you switch inputs, sometimes even images are gone, so you have to turn off/on the TV!

Reviews.Title: Easy to set up great tv
Reviews.Author: Paul in MD
Reviews.Content: For a 32 inch tv it has a great picture and more than enough volume although with all the connections available you can add speakers, dvd player and your pc.

Reviews.Title: Super TV
Reviews.Author: doctrains
Reviews.Content: This is one great little (?) TV at a great price. Picture quality is superb!  You can adjust screen display.  All in all - a nice buy.

Reviews.Title: Toshiba 32 inch
Reviews.Author: maximuslover
Reviews.Content: Great picture and great sound.....great price . Totally better than what I had before. Sound not brassy!!!  You will not be sorry in this purchase

Reviews.Title: I like it...
Reviews.Author: JON "JON"
Reviews.Content: The TV is great and easy to hook up.  I can see how the other reviewer said the stand could be stronger.  It will move a bit from side to side, but seems to stay straight enough.  My problem was that I discovered my cable service was not HD.  A smaller TV tends to have a sharper picture on a lower resolution.  When you get up to the 50 inch, that lower res shows up more in the picture.  Anyway, the Blue Ray player will show off the ability of the larger TV just fine. I might mention that Amazon supplies customer support for this TV for the first 30 days.  I did call with a question regarding the HD and they were extremely helpful and informative.  Also the TV was delivered to me all the way down to Key West, Florida about 5 days earlier than promised, which worked out well for my schedule.  I like a lot of things about Amazon and trust them more every day.

Reviews.Title: Amazing
Reviews.Author: Tarek K.
Reviews.Content: I am really glad that I bought this LEDit's very light, elegant, has a pc connection, amazing colors full HD 1080 pthe only problem is the speakers its not that good quality and there is not many Audio optionsbut still amazing deal with amazing price

Reviews.Title: Could Be More User-Friendly Formatted
Reviews.Author: AthenaisMedomai "Jessie"
Reviews.Content: Great TV for the price, and my family loves it.  It was a gift for Fathers Day and my husband's birthday.  It's our first flat screen HDTV, so definitely worth what I spent.  We like the features, although they could be more user friendly.  Works well with ATT U-Verse.  Easy to put together to put onto an entertainment center, and appeared easy enough to mount on a wall if that's what we chose.Would use this seller again, as the TV arrived timely and exactly as described.

Reviews.Title: Excellent quality
Reviews.Author: IVAN J. ALDANA
Reviews.Content: Expected a little less quality but really good for the money.Will buy Toshiba next time around, they could make the remote a little bit simpler,

Reviews.Title: Not the best, but does a good job
Reviews.Author: Bob Morrow
Reviews.Content: This of course is not the top of the line TV, but it really does a good job. Picture quality is real good and light weight. Only issue I have is the base is a little off kilter, nothing big, just noticeable to someone like me who likes things dress right dress. The base is fixed, you cant swivel the TV otherwise a good buy for me.

Reviews.Title: WOW
Reviews.Author: Bradley Mathies "Design style"
Reviews.Content: I love it, I have been wanting a TV for my shop for almost two years and this was my time to invest in it and I glade I did, the picture is great and the sound is better it help me stay in touch with the news all day.

Reviews.Title: Happy Purchase
Reviews.Author: Food Critic "Glen"
Reviews.Content: This is the first Toshiba item I have owned, save for the CDRW I installed on a computer a dozen or so years ago.  I wasn't interested in a smart TV, so this Toshiba 50L1350U 50-Inch 1080p 120Hz LED HDTV fit perfectly.The clarity is excellent, with great colors.  Even darker scenes show up clearly.  The Blue-ray DVD's we watched on it were incredibly sharp.  The sound is decent, but not fabulous.  I am somewhat disappointed with the remote.  My couch sits about 12 to 15 feet from the TV.  If I'm sitting on the left side of the screen, the TV does not register the remote.  I have to move to the right until I'm directly in front of the sensor in order for it to register.  Since I primarily watch Netflix through my Blue-ray player, this doesn't really matter until I have to adjust the volume.  I may just look into getting a universal remote to see if that doesn't fix my problem.The stand it comes with is flimsy.  Actually, I think it's the entire setup.  I don't recommend leaving it on the stand for long.  It's not solid.  I wish the TV had one additional set of component video hookups, since the kids still play the older gaming consoles, but they don't complain too much about having to swap out the cables.All-in-all this is a great TV for the price, though I've only had it for a month.  Even after reading the overwhelmingly positive reviews, I was skeptical.  But I have to say I am satisfied.  And that's saying quite a bit since I held off buying a TV for 6 months, waiting for the right TV with the right price to come along.

Reviews.Title: Good Price for 29in TV - one dead pixel.
Reviews.Author: ---->Sam<----
Reviews.Content: I did some research before buying this tv and strangely nothing online has the specification for its native resolution or the max resolution of this tv...even on toshiba website it only says this tv is 720p. After i setup my tv to my pc, i found the actual resolution of this tv 1360x768 if you're looking for the specific resolution here you go.As for the TV, $180 price is a very good deal usually only no-name brands offers this price point at this size. I found one dead pixel after setting it up, since it is price cut of $120 and dead pixel is at the corner I'm probably just going to stick with it.Video Quality is fine but my laptop is 1366x768 so switching resolution is a bit annoying.Sound Quality is not bad in my opinion but this is my first(my last TV, a 32in Sceptre only lasted 3 HOURS) tv for my room, so anything its give or take.3 HDMI is nice because LG and Samsung TVs only have 2 HDMI.So far it is working well, hopefully it will last long.Edit 1Connecting to pc issuesSince this tv has a odd resolution of 1360x768, setting the right resolution in your pic settings is very important. My laptop has native 1366x768, part of my screen was cut off due to the extra 6 pixels not being able to display. After setting the right resolution the tv looked crisp and HD from a distance dispite the result ion is a bit lowered.As for the lag issue I've seen people mention, I have no problem playing battlefield 3 on this tv from my laptop. The HDMI cable I have is only $3 I bought from amazon. It is important to turn Vsync on in game setting so the computer will match the 60hz refresh rate with 60fps.Games that I play with this tv:Battlefield 3League of LegendsLeft 4 Dead 2Killing FloorAll have no screen lag problem at 60fps Vsync on.

Reviews.Title: GREAT
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: The purchase was as advertised. It was a Good price and a real value.  It arrived safely and whole with no damage.  Good tv.  Very satisfied with the whole purchase procedure.

Reviews.Title: very good TV
Reviews.Author: Stanley
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV mainly for its RGB feature. I hooked up with my laptop and it gives a very good quality picture and everyone in my family loves this TV and i definitely recommend this one.

Reviews.Title: great tv
Reviews.Author: Child of God
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a gift for a friend and it was the perfect item. She loves it and it is all it should be and more. Thank you

Reviews.Title: Great picture and sound
Reviews.Author: Zac
Reviews.Content: Great HDMI image. Goes to 1080p when hooked into my computer. Sound quality is similarly great and I haven't had any issues with it so far.Only con is the annoying blue stand that holds up the TV. Strange choice and can be distracting at first.

Reviews.Title: Perfect size for my room
Reviews.Author: Meggo39 "Meggo39"
Reviews.Content: Great picture, fits my needs.Stable stand - not the case with other televisions of the same size that I had previously tried.I would definitely recommend it to a friend.

Reviews.Title: Great for the price
Reviews.Author: R. Murray
Reviews.Content: Great TV for the price.  Out of the box the picture appeared to be way off as far as color etc.  Took about 10 min to get everything dialed in and looking good.  The bezel is one of the reasons I went with this screen.  It is so thin and looks really good, TV is also very light (20lb).  This TV will serve as an Xbox / Computer monitor.  For $347 nothing even comes close to specs, looks or picture.  Would recommend and buy another.Only con I can give is the flimsy base can make it wobble if you bump it or touch it..?  I plan to hang it so thats a non issues for me.  Also, the screen isn't a completely matte one.  It has a bit of a shine to it.  Not full blown gloss like most laptop screens but it may be an issue for some.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Eric
Reviews.Content: This is a nice 32 inch TV; great picture, sounds good, perfect for a bedroom. If its a 32 inch your looking for this is what you need.

Reviews.Title: TOSHIBA tV
Reviews.Author: mildred m piper
Reviews.Content: perfect size ,price and the TV works perfect for my needs.  great Tv  would definitely recommend to anyone needing a smaller TV

Reviews.Title: Never buy a Toshiba again
Reviews.Author: M. S. Hanley "nana"
Reviews.Content: This TV, still under manufacturer's warrantee began having problems 2 months ago.  Calls to Toshiba resulted in speaking with someone whose first language was not English, hours on the phone and finally being told that even though I live in a city of over 100,000 the only 2 repair places were 30 mins away in very small towns.  One no longer does repairs and the other, after sending pictures of the screen etc still has not been able to get the needed parts.  So here I sit with a 7 month old tv that does not work and no help from anyone

Reviews.Title: Very nice TV
Reviews.Author: Mark Godbee
Reviews.Content: This TV works very well, has a clear picture and contains several HDMI plug-ins which was a major reson for purchasing this item.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic
Reviews.Author: ELIZABETH
Reviews.Content: I wanted a small flat screen LED HDTV for my bedroom and I'm extremely happy with my Toshiba. Beautiful picture, good sound,and easy to set up. I'm not a techie. I'm a very happy camper! And because I opened an Amazon Prime account with this purchase, I really got the deal of the century!

Reviews.Title: Great tv
Reviews.Author: Manora
Reviews.Content: The picture is great and the sound is good for me.  I think  it was a good buy for the price.  Im glad I bought it.

Reviews.Title: Like it just fine
Reviews.Author: Bob - Manhattan, New York
Reviews.Content: Picture quality is great. Just what I've come to expect from Toshiba tv's.However,the sound quality is disappointing. I would recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: Just Stunning!
Reviews.Author: Mark Decker
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic HDTV.  The picture, both in HD and standard is superior.  Very easy to set up.  I have an Apple TV, BlueRay, and cable connected.  The difference betwee a 55" and a 58" is significant.  So if you have a choice go bigger.  The 58" was as large as I could go with the space i had to work with.You won't go wrong with this unit.  No comprimise on the pictrue given the outstanding price!.  A 240hz refresh rate insures smooth fast moving sports are clear.

Reviews.Title: What I Don't Like About My New TV
Reviews.Author: Vanessa T. Evans
Reviews.Content: I chose this rating because, I'm not getting the full enjoyment of 1080p, and that may not have anything to do with the TV itself, I think it has to do with my cable provider.  But one thing that I don't like about my new TV is the pedestal that it's on, it's a bit shaky, not as sturdy as it could be.

Reviews.Title: Great and easy to set up
Reviews.Author: Angela Shudo "new mommy"
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my mom. It is a great second tv and at this price we could't be happier. The picture is clear and she can navigate it easily.

Reviews.Title: Great price
Reviews.Author: R. Lano "Bobby Ray"
Reviews.Content: I have a 46" top of line Toshiba bought back in Oct 2010. Fab picture and features.But this 39" one, while only replacing my bedroom TV which the ex stole, is okay but lacks a bit of the picture quality that the 47" one did.Could just be the picture size being smaller.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Alex S.
Reviews.Content: I've had this tv for a little over a month now and I really enjoy it. I bought the 32-inch model and it's perfect for my bedroom, the stand was easy to attach and the settings are pretty simple for the un-savvy like myself. I enjoy bass, and the speakers do a pretty good job of supplying great, sound after fiddling witht the bass and treble settings. Only thing is that if the bass and treble are set too high the speakers vibrate which is to be expected (everything has a limit) but it's a little depressing. I plan to get a wireless soundbar at some point in the future, but for tv speakers, they are pretty powerful. Volume at 20 and it's blaring so that's great. Picture quality is beautiful, and the different modes are fun (Gaming, Movie, Dynamic, Standard). I usually leave mine in Dynamic as most other settings are very dark (especially Gaming).All in all, would recommend to others. Great product for the job.

Reviews.Title: Perfect size
Reviews.Author: John L Moss
Reviews.Content: Quality picture, perfect size for kitchen counter although volume adjustment between HD and other channels is a little too much.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Value - excellent choice
Reviews.Author: Bluewater Business Consulting LLC
Reviews.Content: I had my heart set on a Samsung but was unwilling to spend quite that much, however this Toshiba is easily as clear and amazing a picture than the Samsung TVs I had researched. It is like sitting in the middle of the movie. Sound quality is good and it is quietly unobtrusive for a 58" screen!

Reviews.Title: Toshiba23-inch tv
Reviews.Author: Christine Popp "vettechick"
Reviews.Content: Needed a small-ish tv but still wanted big color and big sound.  It rocks!  Great picture.  I would but this again.

Reviews.Title: Good Item
Reviews.Author: Joe Lopez
Reviews.Content: Great item for the price can not go wrong , I will recommend this item to any one who needs it

Reviews.Title: Exactly what I was looking for! Excellent value for a near 60 in. HDTV!
Reviews.Author: TheNotoriousMAZ
Reviews.Content: Considering I already had a multitude of "smart devices" such as my Xbox and Chromecast to access Netflix, internet etc, I had no need for a smart TV. Having a big screen was a priority, and I wanted at least 120 Hz. The "dumb TV" market is certainly dwindling, but it makes sense to save a few bucks and forego the smart features if you can already get them elsewhere.My shopping search brought me to this model Toshiba, and a 60 in. Samsung (UN60FH6003F), both which could be had for less than $1000. I was able to see both models in person; the Toshiba at Paul's TV, and the Samsung at Costco. Both were close in terms of performance, but the 240 Hz and quicker response time for gaming won me over for the Toshiba.After optimizing the screen settings over the past couple weeks, the picture quality now astonishes me everyday. Blacks are deep and colors pop without being too saturated. The only thing I negative thing I can say about picture quality (and deducted a star for in this review) is that there is some backlight bleed in the bottom left corner when the screen is completely dark. This only happens late at night when the TV is the only thing illuminating the room. Otherwise it is unnoticeable.The sound from the built-in speakers is nothing to write home about, but that seems to be the case with most flatscreens. I have a 5.1 system, and pairing that sound quality with this great screen brings a top-notch entertainment experience. If you do not have a sound system, I would highly recommend getting a sound bar at the very least.I was a bit wary when I bought this TV because there were so few first-hand reviews out for it. Some reviews mentioned that the TV stopped working after a few weeks, or even arrived completely dead. That was not the case for me, and I will knock on wood for good longevity. I consider myself lucky finding this Toshiba for only $799 at Sears, and can say with confidence that it is an excellent bargain. If you are searching for great picture quality in a big screen without the added bloat of smart software, look no further. I can recommend this unit with confidence.***This is a copy of my review from Sears, where I purchased this TV. Amazon is where I come for my user reviews, and want to contribute here as well.***

Reviews.Title: Overall great TV
Reviews.Author: D. W. Clark
Reviews.Content: This is a great TV for the price, it has a great picture, it's lightweight and easy to setup.  My only complaint is that Toshiba televisions don't have a good low volume.  I originally bought this for a bedroom, but on volume level 1, it can be heard clearly in the hallway.  It is not so loud that it would be a bad TV for a office or living room, but I would rather it be a little quieter for my bedroom.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Yellow Bee
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV as part of a quest to make my home more energy efficient. This is a great bedroom TV. I has descent sound and a great picture.

Reviews.Title: Truly great for the price
Reviews.Author: Rebecca
Reviews.Content: Great picture, good color, definition outstanding when hooked to HD.  For just under $200, the TV is really a great value

Reviews.Title: looks, features
Reviews.Author: brian hase
Reviews.Content: love this tv , great picture, easy controls , sound is great, clean, crisp, sharp picture, easy remote, good looking

Reviews.Title: Ok for a budget tv in bedroom.
Reviews.Author: Eva M. Wilson
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my daughter and she likes it.  Not the best picture, but ok.  You get what you pay for...

Reviews.Title: brilliant
Reviews.Author: ana teresa romero
Reviews.Content: if you want a tv with good sound quality and this is your choice I loveclear that it is a bit wide but very light so 100% recommended

Reviews.Title: Crisp & Clear
Reviews.Author: L. Cerny
Reviews.Content: I upgraded from a 19" AOC as I needed at least two HDMI inputs AND still have  ports for older game consoles.  It was easy to unpack and plug in all the cables.  I did not expect the quality of the picture to be so high; it is real HD and is crisp, bright, and runs cool.  As a monitor, it is nice having the extra desktop space to work on multiple projects.  As a TV, the picture is really gorgeous.  Fallout 3 (2008) looks very good and is definitely more immersive on a wider screen, but I have not hooked up my Nintendo 64 to check the quality.The initial monitor set-up is a little difficult as there are many options.  Correcting the PC input viewable area (without having those black bars on the sides) was the hardest part, but there are many websites which explain how to adjust the picture size while keeping the font readable.I do have a problem with the speakers.  Any volume setting over a "10" creates bass reverb; not horrible, but noticeable even after turning the bass all the way down.  As this device is primarily a PC monitor, I sit close and keep the volume at a "4" or a "5".  I can see the sound being an issue if this device is used as a TV and viewers are sitting at a distance.  The sound also seems to be better coming from the back of the monitor, but that could just be my unit.I would give this monitor a five if it weren't for the speaker issue.

Reviews.Title: Remote!
Reviews.Author: Carolyn
Reviews.Content: Love the TV, picture is great, however the remote could be better. Have to push too hard on the buttons.  It needs to be better quality.

Reviews.Title: Lovely LCD
Reviews.Author: H. Yousef
Reviews.Content: Very happy with his tv, picture is sharp, sound is strong and it's slim, bought a little one for the bedroom.

Reviews.Title: great smaller tv for the money
Reviews.Author: Lacey Morton
Reviews.Content: the only thing i night change is the mute button. one press of the mute button halves the volume. have to press twice to get mute.lpm

Reviews.Title: Toshiba 58"
Reviews.Author: David W Erb
Reviews.Content: The main power supply board went out within the first week. Called Toshiba, no questions asked they had it repaired in my home within a week. The picture quality is great, the refresh rate is great, I would buy another.

Reviews.Title: Very Nice TV
Reviews.Author: Ann
Reviews.Content: We are enjoying this TV.  It is certainly an improvement over what we had before.  Wish they made these TVs with the speakers in the front instead of in the back.

Reviews.Title: Love this 39-inch TV
Reviews.Author: NorCalGal
Reviews.Content: After using this TV for over a month now I have absolutely no complaints!  It's a perfect size, with lots of setup options on the menu. And, it was a super easy install on my DirecTV service, too.  All in all, from receipt of this TV right thru the complete install, including the DirecTV remote setup - it took 37 minutes.  The picture is great, the sound is great, the menu is easy to use.  A very good buy for the price, indeed!

Reviews.Title: Just what I was looking for.
Reviews.Author: m bollen
Reviews.Content: For the price, great product. What sold me was the analog audio outputs. This was the only set I could find that would allow me to hook into my old stereo system. All features from the remote transferred to my universal remote. Easy to use ( thinking about getting one for my father).

Reviews.Title: Perfect fit; great picture.
Reviews.Author: David Styron
Reviews.Content: This TV fit perfectly in the space I planned for it.  It looks great and has a very good picture on my HD FiOS television setup.  Very pleased with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Nancy Hughes
Reviews.Content: Great picture and easy to set up. The stand is better than I thought it would be, very sturdy. Just the right size for our bedroom.

Reviews.Title: Nice speakers, okay video, occasional audio problems
Reviews.Author: McGroarty
Reviews.Content: The speakers are surprisingly nice, given the small display. There isn't room-shaking bass by any means, but the low end isn't absent the way it normally is on small monitors.The video quality is nothing to write home about. It's a bit muddy, as if the video is pinned to something less than 24-bit color. The effect is most noticeable on flesh, which looks pasty. It has a wide color range regardless, and it has temperature customization as well as the familiar contrast and brightness settings. There are also some mpeg and digital noise reduction options that don't work as well as the counterparts on Sony TVs. There's some kind of edge enhancement filter that creates a sort of embossing effect even when it's disabled - the effect is more pronounced when it's set to "on." It's pronounced enough that you wouldn't want to use this as a PC display.My big problem is that the TV sometimes powers on with a problem where it plays TV static then silence, even when on an HDMI input. Powering off and back on again is the only thing that seems to bring audio back. The static is quite loud and sends my cat fleeing the room every time.

Reviews.Title: Toshiba LED HDTV
Reviews.Author: Hank
Reviews.Content: Very nice monitor. Love it. Mounted it in the corner of our camper and the picture and clarity are outstanding.

Reviews.Title: worth the value
Reviews.Author: Aria
Reviews.Content: been a while since I bought a TV, was easy to assemble and light, pictures are great. just need to see longevity

Reviews.Title: Amazing
Reviews.Author: Dana
Reviews.Content: I sent this to my grandfather as a gift for his birthday. Toshiba 32-Inch TV came on time in great condition! you couldn't even tell it was used before!

Reviews.Title: Amazing TV
Reviews.Author: Morabito
Reviews.Content: This TV was a great buy.The price was reasonable for a 120Hz TV and the quality is great.This is a great improvment over my old CRT tv.

Reviews.Title: Good for the price
Reviews.Author: T. Law "TL"
Reviews.Content: This is a good tv for the price. The quality seems fine though the tv itself is very lightweight and I was a little concerned at first. Picture quality is noticeably less than the more expensive models but fair enough. You get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: Not a big TV watcher
Reviews.Author: Joe
Reviews.Content: Please take into consideration that I am not a avid TV watcher.  I bought this TV for it's size to fit in my entertainment center in my living/family room.  The room size is approximately 12'x15 and the 32" TV was the largest that would fit in the entertainment center space.  The farthest distance any chair is from the TV is approx. eight feet.  I would think anything larger than a 32" TV would be over kill.  The TV was very easy to assemble and set up.  The picture and sound is everything that all professional reviews say.  In addition, it was very easy to route the sound through my stereo with RCA cords when I wish theater quality sound.  It is also easy to watch shows streaming off my computer and Kindle with simply plugging in HDMI cords from my TV to computer/Kindle.

Reviews.Title: I LOVE THIS TELEVISION
Reviews.Author: Rozaroni
Reviews.Content: Easy to set up, 1080p HD, 3 HDMI ports, great color, great sound. Chromecast setup was a breeze! What's not to love?

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the price
Reviews.Author: Paul
Reviews.Content: I've had no problems with it. i have it set up in the bedroom less than 3 feet from me and the picture is super clear.Only problem is that it takes a long time to warm up, up to 30 seconds, and sometimes doesn't turn on on the first push of the remote.Considering the price the warm up time and turning on are small problems

Reviews.Title: great picture
Reviews.Author: Patrick Dickson
Reviews.Content: great tv. for the money. more than happy with this purchase, all my friends comment on how great it looks

Reviews.Title: Claims to play USB Video are false
Reviews.Author: Ran
Reviews.Content: Picture and audio are OK but the USB video playback does not support standard file formats such as mp4, avi, or mkv.  Very disappointed :(

Reviews.Title: Was good but now ???
Reviews.Author: Mike Calimari
Reviews.Content: Great set at first with good picture for its resolution and has HIDMI inputs.  The missus had connected to her laptop as a secondary display for her work and the information display was easy to read. Absolutely no complaints about the picture or performance for the price, @ <$200.The bad:  The TV still works but you can't input anything with the remote.  I don't know if the remote died or if the sensor or its circuit inside the set went south in 4 months time.  The remote does pass the camera test, aim your remote at a digital camera wand watch its screen as you press the remote's buttons. You should see the IR emitter bulb glow.The set has a year warranty but must be sent to a repair center. The cost of shipping, insurance then cosmetic damage (we haven't removed the protective film yet as it is in a temp location) by the repair technicians means we'll probably keep it as is.

Reviews.Title: Better than I anticipated.
Reviews.Author: Rein D.
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a tv to bring to college for my dorm room. Of course I didn't want something too big so I found this nice 32" toshiba for a great price. I was also looking for a good gaming tv and with the 3 hdmi inputs and 120hz, this was perfect. I was worried about the 720p however because I wanted the graphics to be the best they could possibly be, but I bought it anyways since I couldn't find a better tv out there for such a good price, believe me I looked. Turns out when you use the hdmi ports for one of your gaming consoles, the resolution bumps up to the full 1080p. This tv was much better than I had expected and if you're looking for a nice tv, for gaming or just for television, that doesn't take up a lot of space and looks great, I highly recommend this one.

Reviews.Title: Excelent choice.
Reviews.Author: Carlos Ruben Soto
Reviews.Content: It's looks great. The quality of the picture is excelent and the sound is superb. Love it. I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Great for the price.
Reviews.Author: Avid Fan
Reviews.Content: Got this to replace an old 27" tube tv from the early 90's (it's still kicking though) in the bedroom.
